alert.note: Alert for Inland Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EVANS, LIBERTY, EFFINGHAM, CHATHAM AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 317 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Godley Station, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph, up to penny sized hail and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Pooler, Pembroke, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, Lanier, Rincon, and Garden City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify. Be certain to monitor local radio and TV stations as well as local cable TV outlets for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
